Completion Prompts: Write one sentence blessing the startup as it ends.
List two gifts you will carry forward within 60 days and assign owners.
Name one ritual act and the date you will complete it.

Primary Scenarios: A founder must end or hand off a venture and wants to do so cleanly and with dignity.

Overall Outcomes.Excellent: Carries forward learnings and relationships while releasing residue.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: Acknowledges the ending and makes space for what’s next.
Overall Outcomes.Poor: Clings to the startup identity; energy leaks and new directions stall.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Ending the venture becomes a blessing that strengthens the founder’s future field.

Overall Purpose: To release identification with a venture that has reached its end so new life can emerge without distortion.

Guiding Questions: What exactly is ending—and what is not?
Who needs to hear this now, in what order, using what channel?
What date or boundary marks completion?
Themes.Name: Facing the Ending Directly

Excellent.30-90 day system effect: Trust stabilizes; stakeholders coordinate endings cleanly.
Excellent.Example moves: Decision log entry + tailored stakeholder Q&A.
Excellent.Present pattern: Communicates the ending with context, timing, and care for people.

Expected.30-90 day system effect: Alignment improves; planning stabilizes around closure.
Expected.Example moves: One-paragraph closure note naming scope, timing, and what’s not ending.
Expected.Future effect: Clean pivot becomes possible without hidden drag.
Expected.Immediate cost: Short-term discomfort for you and others.
Expected.Present pattern: States the ending plainly and compassionately.
Expected.Signals: Direct language; fewer mixed messages; visible relief.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Misalignment and scope creep continue; decisions stall.
Poor.Example moves: Drafts keep getting edited without sending; meetings avoid the topic.
Poor.Future effect: Unended ending shows up later as friction and rework.
Poor.Present pattern: Avoids or downplays the ending; keeps options vaguely open.

Transcendent.Example moves: Simple public post: thank, release, open next door.
Transcendent.Future effect: Endings become a strategic capability in the culture.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Names the ending as part of a larger field rhythm and learning arc.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To name clearly that the venture is ending and what remains.
Themes.Why This Matters: Ambiguity prolongs suffering and confuses stakeholders.

Guiding Questions: Where did I fuse my identity with this startup?
Which anchors will hold me through and after the ending?
What would dignified self-talk sound like now?
Themes.Name: Releasing the Founder Identity

Excellent.30-90 day system effect: Direction clarifies; energy returns to the body.
Excellent.Edge condition: Don’t rebrand prematurely to escape feeling.
Excellent.Example moves: Calendar two anchor practices for the next month.

Expected.30-90 day system effect: Choices become steadier and more humane.
Expected.Example moves: Name two enduring anchors (practice, relationships, place).
Expected.Future effect: A more stable self leads cleaner endings.
Expected.Immediate cost: Ego sting followed by relief and perspective.
Expected.Present pattern: Names identity as larger than the venture.
Expected.Signals: Both/and language about self; less reactivity.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Fragile decision-making and burnout risk increase.
Poor.Edge condition: Collapse into self-judgment or image management.
Poor.Example moves: Write three truths about you that persist beyond this venture.
Poor.Future effect: Identity spirals reappear in the next chapter.
Poor.Present pattern: Self equals startup; worth tracks metrics.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Trust in you rises across the field.
Transcendent.Example moves: Name the gift the venture gave your character.
Transcendent.Future effect: Future work benefits from wiser presence.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Allows grieving to enlarge humility and presence.
Transcendent.Signals: Warmer tone; listening first; patient timing.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To separate self-worth from the venture’s fate.
Themes.Why This Matters: Over-identification makes endings feel annihilating and distorts future choices.

Guiding Questions: Which gifts are alive and reusable?
Where will the top two be used in 60 days?
Who needs to receive or witness each gift?
Themes.Name: Harvesting the Gifts

Excellent.Edge condition: Don’t force weak gifts to live.
Excellent.Example moves: Add gifts as tasks with acceptance criteria.
Excellent.Present pattern: Integrates gifts into near-term plans and roadmaps.
Excellent.Signals: Living documents updated; fewer cold starts.

Expected.30-90 day system effect: Faster starts and clearer handoffs later.
Expected.Example moves: Assign owners for the top two gifts with first reuse dates.
Expected.Immediate cost: Time and attention to write and share.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Reinventing wheels next time; degraded morale.
Poor.Edge condition: Revisionist blame or avoidance of specifics.
Poor.Example moves: List five gifts: skill, asset, relationship, insight, ritual.
Poor.Future effect: Value evaporates; next chapter starts from zero.
Poor.Present pattern: Binary success/failure story erases nuanced learning.

Transcendent.Example moves: Publish ‘what endures’ and who to thank.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Updates the field narrative with what endures.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To preserve lessons, assets, and relationships worth carrying forward.
Themes.Why This Matters: If we don’t name what lives, we lose compounding value and continuity.

Guiding Questions: What residue is still present in me?
What amends or acknowledgments are mine to make?
What small ritual will mark this release?
Themes.Name: Clearing Lingering Residue

Excellent.Future effect: Relational fabric strengthens beyond the ending.
Excellent.Present pattern: Completes amends or micro-repairs where appropriate.

Expected.Present pattern: Names residue and chooses a simple release method.
Expected.Signals: Softer body; fewer rehashes; steadier pacing.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Decision friction and defensive posture persist.
Poor.Edge condition: Mistaking venting for clearing; forcing reconciliation.
Poor.Example moves: Unsent letter or private voice memo; burn/delete.
Poor.Future effect: Past pain steers future choices and pacing.
Poor.Immediate cost: Lower energy; edgy tone in small moments.
Poor.Present pattern: Carries hidden residue; replays conflicts privately.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Culture normalizes honest closure over speed.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Avoid spiritual bypass; feel before blessing.
Transcendent.Example moves: Shared moment of blessing with witnesses.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Transforms residue into compassion and clarity.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To release regret, resentment, and leftover tension tied to the startup.
Themes.Why This Matters: Uncleared residue quietly drains energy and reactivates old patterns.

Guiding Questions: What simple ritual will you actually complete?
What smallest next step affirms the new chapter?
Themes.Name: Ritual of Release and Recommitment

Excellent.Edge condition: Guard against scope creep disguised as momentum.
Excellent.Example moves: Calendar the smallest whole move in the next 7 days.
Excellent.Present pattern: Names one living thread and a first next step.

Expected.30-90 day system effect: Emotion integrates; memory settles; focus returns.
Expected.Example moves: Speak the goodbye line; place an object; close with one breath.
Expected.Future effect: Endings become easier to enact next time.
Expected.Immediate cost: A few minutes of presence and breath.
Expected.Present pattern: Completes a short, sincere ritual with or without a witness.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Residue resurfaces during next work cycle.
Poor.Example moves: Choose a 5–10 minute ritual you will actually do.
Poor.Future effect: Closure keeps slipping into future conflicts.
Poor.Immediate cost: Closure feels incomplete; energy remains stuck.
Poor.Present pattern: Skips ritual; stays purely cerebral and ‘productive’.
Poor.Signals: Flat tone; quick pivot; no marker.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Collective coherence rises across the network.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Hold humility and sincerity as it scales.
Transcendent.Example moves: Publish a short ‘how we end’ note others can adopt.
Transcendent.Future effect: Endings seed regenerative beginnings beyond your team.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Ritual becomes a shared practice of dignified endings.
Transcendent.Signals: Others request or mirror the practice.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To mark the ending with an embodied act and name the first small step forward.
Themes.Why This Matters: Ritual anchors memory and release, turning endings into clean beginnings.

Title: Letting Go of the Startup
When To Use This Protocol: When a venture must be closed or handed on, and you want to do so cleanly and with dignity.
Why This Matters: Founders often hold on beyond the natural end, draining energy. Letting go with clarity allows integrity and renewal.
